data.text: @LibDanielleJ I feel (hope) they should be fine. There is major flooding, but people knew was coming once the rain system decided to pause right on top of South East Queensland. The low lying areas in Boonah are well known so if they’re in one, they should’ve had time to prepare. ❤️
@Infoventurer Biblical stories aside, there is a petrol station over the road so it’s not outside the realms of possibility.
@kylastephan It’s not on fire yet … give it time …
@kylastephan My aunt and uncle live in Boonah. Hope they are ok.

@saoghal_beag Really? A miserable night to wait though he looked pretty self sufficient. I assume he was winding through unfamiliar back roads dodging water. At least he’s safe in town and the IGA was open if he needed food etc.
@kylastephan He’s still there. Weird tho as they always close early Sundays - it’s aratula or sit tight
@kylastephan We’re ok thanks - damp and anxious but thankfully nothing more.
@saoghal_beag I feel for the poor out of town guy standing beside his big car at a locked bowser. We directed him to the other service station before realising it was closed too.
